lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Kremlin leader Mikhail Gorbachev has described machine-builing as a sector whose rapid modernization is essential if the Soviet Union is to compete effectively on world markets.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Western governments view official Soviet estimates for defense spending as highly understated, but say the real figure is hard to calculate because Soviet military industries are intertwined with the civilian economy.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Talyzin said the ruling Politburo had concluded at a recent meeting that an improvement in economic performance depended to a large extent on conserving resources better.
